text: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought; and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
author: G. K. Chesterton

text: Gratitude turns a meal into a feast.
author: Anonymous

text: Notice the ordinary; it is where joy likes to wait.
author: Anonymous

text: Count kind acts, not only coins.
author: Anonymous

text: When you say 'enough,' your heart hears 'abundance.'
author: Anonymous

text: Let thanks be the period at the end of every day.
author: Anonymous

text: Give thanks for the roof and for the rain upon it.
author: Anonymous

text: What you appreciate, appreciates.
author: Anonymous

text: The gift of the moment is often wrapped in plain paper.
author: Anonymous

text: Gratitude is a light you can carry anywhere.
author: Anonymous

text: Enough is a decision, not a number.
author: Anonymous

text: The thankful heart has a long memory.
author: Anonymous

text: Say ‘thank you’ out loud—joy likes to echo.
author: Anonymous

text: Notice three good things and watch your day change.
author: Anonymous

text: Turn chores into chances to be thankful.
author: Anonymous

text: Gratitude makes simple things shine.
author: Anonymous

text: Let appreciation interrupt complaint.
author: Anonymous

text: A grateful mind finds generous solutions.
author: Anonymous

text: Thank what stayed, bless what left.
author: Anonymous

text: Write your thanks; ink remembers.
author: Anonymous
